filmography.title: Wuthering Heights
filmography.role_description: A brooding, vengeful orphan who is tormented by his unrequited love for his foster sister, Cathy, on the Yorkshire moors.
filmography.plot: A servant in the house of Wuthering Heights tells a traveler the unfortunate tale of lovers Heathcliff and Cathy.

filmography.title: Rebecca
filmography.role_description: A wealthy widower who marries a naive young woman, but is haunted by the mysterious death and memory of his first wife.
filmography.plot: A self-conscious woman juggles adjusting to her new role as an aristocrat's wife and avoiding being intimidated by his first wife's spectral presence.

filmography.title: Pride and Prejudice
filmography.role_description: The proud, aristocratic, and misunderstood suitor who clashes with the witty Elizabeth Bennet in Regency England.
filmography.plot: Mr. and Mrs. Bennet have five unmarried daughters, and Mrs. Bennet is especially anxious to see them all married to wealthy men.

filmography.title: That Hamilton Woman
filmography.role_description: The heroic British naval commander who engages in a scandalous adulterous affair with Lady Emma Hamilton during the Napoleonic Wars.
filmography.plot: A story of the romance between Lord Admiral Nelson and Lady Emma Hamilton.

filmography.title: 49th Parallel
filmography.role_description: A French-Canadian trapper who confronts a stranded group of Nazi U-boat sailors trying to cross Canada.
filmography.plot: A U-boat crew are stranded in northern Canada. To avoid internment, they must make their way to the border and escape into a neutral United States.

filmography.title: Henry V
filmography.role_description: The warrior king of England who leads his troops into the Battle of Agincourt, delivering some of Shakespeare's most famous speeches.
filmography.plot: In the midst of the Hundred Years' War, the young King Henry V of England embarks on the conquest of France in 1415.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Oscar: Honorary Award

filmography.title: Hamlet
filmography.role_description: The melancholy Prince of Denmark who seeks revenge against his uncle for murdering his father and usurping the throne.
filmography.plot: Prince Hamlet struggles over whether or not he should kill his uncle, whom he suspects has murdered his father, the former King.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Oscar: Win – Best Picture

filmography.title: Carrie
filmography.role_description: A respectable restaurant manager who ruins his life and career by falling in love with a younger woman and stealing for her.
filmography.plot: A young woman moves to the big city where she begins an affair with a married man that leads to his ruin.

filmography.title: The Beggar's Opera
filmography.role_description: A dashing highwayman and scoundrel who sings his way through imprisonment and multiple romances in this musical adaptation.
filmography.plot: A highwayman is imprisoned and sentenced to death, but recounts his musical exploits to a beggar.

filmography.title: Richard III
filmography.role_description: The hunchbacked, Machiavellian duke who murders and schemes his way to the English throne.
filmography.plot: Richard, Duke of Gloucester, stops at nothing to become King of England.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; BAFTA: Win – Best British Actor

filmography.title: The Prince and the Showgirl
filmography.role_description: A stiff, formal European royal visiting London who is charmed and baffled by a lively American showgirl.
filmography.plot: An American showgirl becomes entangled in political intrigue when the Prince Regent of a foreign country attempts to seduce her.

filmography.title: The Devil's Disciple
filmography.role_description: A witty, sophisticated British General during the American Revolution who engages in verbal sparring with a colonial rebel.
filmography.plot: The black sheep of a family and a local minister discover their true vocations during the American War of Independence.

filmography.title: Spartacus
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, ambitious Roman patrician and general who seeks to crush the slave rebellion and destroy Spartacus.
filmography.plot: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.

filmography.title: The Entertainer
filmography.role_description: A failing, hollow music-hall performer who manipulates his family while desperately trying to keep his career alive.
filmography.plot: A third-rate vaudeville performer keeps his show on the road despite his personal life falling apart.

filmography.title: Term of Trial
filmography.role_description: A disillusioned, alcoholic schoolteacher who is falsely accused of assault by a student who has a crush on him.
filmography.plot: A shy teacher refuses to give a student a passing grade, leading her to accuse him of sexual assault.

filmography.title: Bunny Lake Is Missing
filmography.role_description: A calm, methodical police superintendent investigating the disappearance of a child who may not even exist.
filmography.plot: A woman reports that her young daughter is missing, but there seems to be no evidence that she ever existed.

filmography.title: Othello
filmography.role_description: The Moorish general of Venice who is manipulated into a jealous rage by his ensign Iago, leading to tragedy.
filmography.plot: A filmed stage production of Shakespeare's play about a Moorish general who is tricked into believing his wife has been unfaithful.

filmography.title: Khartoum
filmography.role_description: The charismatic Sudanese religious leader who leads a revolt against British rule, opposing General Gordon.
filmography.plot: British General Charles Gordon defends Khartoum against the forces of the Mahdi, a Sudanese religious leader.

filmography.title: Oh! What a Lovely War
filmography.role_description: A satirical portrayal of the British commander during WWI, highlighting the disconnect between leadership and the trenches.
filmography.plot: A musical satire of World War I, chronicling the war through the members of one British family.

filmography.title: Battle of Britain
filmography.role: Air Chief Marshal Sir Hugh Dowding
filmography.role_description: The mastermind behind the British air defense strategy during the critical WWII battle against the Luftwaffe.
filmography.plot: In 1940, the British Royal Air Force fights a desperate battle to prevent the Luftwaffe from gaining air superiority over the English Channel.

filmography.title: Sleuth
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, eccentric mystery writer who engages in a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with his wife's lover.
filmography.plot: A man who loves games and theater invites his wife's lover to his house for a battle of wits with potentially deadly results.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; NYFCC: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Marathon Man
filmography.role_description: A terrifying Nazi war criminal known as 'The White Angel' who comes to New York to retrieve stolen diamonds.
filmography.plot: A history student gets caught in the middle of a dangerous international plot involving a Nazi war criminal and stolen diamonds.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: A Bridge Too Far
filmography.role_description: A compassionate Dutch doctor who tries to care for the wounded Allied soldiers during the failed Operation Market Garden.
filmography.plot: Operation Market Garden, September 1944: The Allies attempt to capture several strategically important bridges in the Netherlands in the hope of breaking the German lines.

filmography.title: The Boys from Brazil
filmography.role_description: An aging Nazi hunter based on Simon Wiesenthal who uncovers a sinister plot to clone Adolf Hitler.
filmography.plot: A Nazi hunter in Paraguay discovers a plot to rekindle the Third Reich involving the cloning of Adolf Hitler.

filmography.title: Clash of the Titans
filmography.role_description: The King of the Gods who manipulates the fate of his son Perseus and the other mortals from Mount Olympus.
filmography.plot: Perseus must battle Medusa and the Kraken to save the Princess Andromeda.

filmography.title: The Bounty
filmography.role_description: The British Admiral who presides over the court-martial of Captain Bligh following the mutiny on the Bounty.
filmography.plot: A retelling of the mutiny on the HMS Bounty, focusing on the conflict between Lieutenant Bligh and Fletcher Christian.
